modules.description: Handles UDPv4 communication by providing functions to write datagrams with optional source ports and TTL, and to demultiplex incoming traffic based on destination ports. Operates on IP addresses, buffers, and custom error types, with a callback system for processing received data. Used to manage network interactions where precise control over packet delivery and reception is required.

The module offers functions for managing TCP connections, including reading, writing, and closing flows, along with keepalive configuration and error handling. It operates on TCP flows, IP addresses, ports, buffers, and connection states to facilitate data transmission and flow control. Use cases include server applications requiring reliable communication and managing persistent connections with timeout adjustments.

Provides pretty-printers for IP addresses and errors, and supports demultiplexing incoming IP traffic based on protocol, sending packets with configurable options like fragmentation and TTL, and calculating pseudoheaders for checksums. Operates on IP addresses, buffers, and connection handles. Used for handling IP layer communication, including packet routing, error reporting, and network interface configuration.

Provides functions for establishing and managing network stack operations, including IP packet transmission and reception, ARP handling, and interface configuration. Works with data types such as IP addresses, MAC addresses, and packet buffers. Used to implement custom network stacks in MirageOS applications requiring low-level network control.

Manages network communication at the IP, TCP, and UDP layers, enabling precise control over packet transmission, connection management, and traffic demultiplexing. It handles IP addresses, buffers, and connection states, supporting operations like sending datagrams, establishing TCP flows, and generating checksums. Functions include setting TTL, configuring keepalives, and processing incoming traffic based on port and protocol. Examples include building custom network protocols, implementing servers with reliable TCP streams, and routing IP packets with specific options.
